title: Fancy logo font
content:
Does anyone know the font used in this logo?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113021526im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_6347.png)
author: Djeurissen

comments.content:
Perhaps our typophiles are stumped because the logo is extensively edited. About all I can offer are a couple of thoughts on origin of the base font.  
This is a thickened version of measured designs that can trace their lineage to Trafton, designed by Howard Trafton and cast by Bauer in1933; Coronet designed by R. H. Middleton for Ludlow in 1937; and Stylescript designed by Sol Hess in 1940 for the Lanston Monotype Company. Harold's Fonts has digitized Stylescrpt as [Swizzle Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113021526/http:/www.fontbros.com/families/swizzle-script/styles/regular/?code=identifont). The logo in Swizzle Script:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150113021526im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SwizzleScript_4532.jpg)
  
Don
